Description: Lower body sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; yellowish white slip; exterior: from top, tendrils; crescents; lotus flower and bud band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For parallels regarding the tendril decoration, see Reading 26.2.55.
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 10, no. 26150)
Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 42, no. 152, pl. 36)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.016)
